title: Is asking my parents or siblings for things or favours considered as begging? - assim al hakeem
transcript: I notice in one of your videos like you're talking about begging and like how asking is begging so like if I ask like my siblings to get me something like so from a computer or like a game or something like that or ask them for my parents it's a character guys is begging or is it just like me requesting something begging is asking people for something that such people are not obliged to provide you for it your parents are your parents so they are obliged to provide you for whatever you may need especially if you're not working if you're a student if you're not earning and asking them is permissible it's not begging asking your siblings for such favors when you know that they are giving without any ill feelings and when they ask you to do something for them you would do that similarly this is not begging begging is when you go to people you know and you say well I like that pen you have can I have it can I uh take this or that can you buy me something can you give me money can you pay for my uh gym uh subscription Etc this is begging this is something that honorable people don't ask and this is why the companions may Allah be pleased with them they say that we gave the prophet Allah the Pledge of Allegiance when we accepted Islam and among the Pledge of Allegiance is that we do not ask anyone for anything and the narrator of the Hadith goes on to say and I used to see one of them that is the companions Riding on His camel dropping his whip and he would Dismount of his camel to take the whip instead of asking the people walking around him excuse me please can you hand me the whip he would not do that because this is what he gave the pledge of allegiance to the prophet Islam to honor themselves and not to ask people for such favors in order not to be among those who beg others or depend on them and Allah Knows Best we
